location: 6th Ave. and Kennedy Drive, San Francisco, CA Golden Gate Park San Francisco
event_description:
There is a place in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park that is heaven for Bay Area inline skaters and roller skaters who like to boogie to the funky beat on wheels. 

The Godfather of Skate brings his mobile DJ unit and plays groovy tunes for you to skate to. On most Sundays, there's usually someone willing to teach you a few choreographed roller disco dance moves. 

Golden Gate Park Sunday Roller Disco Party
Most Sundays | Noon to 5 pm
6th Ave & Kennedy Drive, Golden Gate Park
FREE

The area is called, "Skatin' Place." It is located at 6th Avenue and Kennedy Drive in the park. It has been officially dedicated and recognized as the home for outdoor roller skating in the San Francisco. Skatin' Place is available for skating every day. The group skates there every Sunday from noon to 5 pm. Skaters gather on Wednesdays from about 3 to 5 pm and on Saturdays from 1 to 5 pm. During Daylight Saving Time, they extend the time to 6 pm.
event_name: Golden Gate Park Sunday Roller Disco Party (SF)

location: 75 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr, San Francisco, CA
event_description:
The Japanese Tea Garden provides visitors from around the world with an opportunity to experience the natural beauty, tranquility and harmony of a Japanese-style garden in the heart of San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park. 

The Japanese Tea Garden is a popular attraction in San Francisco that features classic elements such as an arched drum bridge, pagodas, stone lanterns, stepping stone paths, native Japanese plants, serene koi ponds and a zen garden. The garden is open from March to September and offers free hours to residents of San Francisco.
event_name: Free Admission Hour “Japanese Tea Garden” at Golden Gate Park (SF)

location: 755 Frederick St., San Francisco, CA Sunset District San Francisco
event_description:
Some evil web browsers and adblocker plug-ins disable our contest entry form. Please try a different browser,  or if you're behind a corporate firewall, you may need to try on your home computer.

Ready to fly? Try something new and enter to win a free 90-minute Flying Trapeze class for you and a friend at San Francisco’s Circus Center.

Perfect for beginners, highly-trained instructors will take you through “ground school,” teach you all the basics and then get you up and swinging and doing basic tricks on San Francisco’s ONLY flying trapeze.

There are seven “All Levels” trapeze classes for you to choose from each week including on weekends and in the evenings.

Want to give the circus a try? Join us for $5 Fridays on February 24, 2023. The Circus Center resumes their popular Friday night out for just the third time in two years so you can try your hand at juggling, plate spinning and balancing acts, plus watch a short flying trapeze performance from the Circus Center Flyers and win prizes. Got another $5? You can get in the air! Go through “ground school” training and then take your swing on SF’s only flying trapeze
event_name: Win Tix: Take a Swing on SF’s Only Flying Trapeze (90-Minute Class)

event_description:
The event is a free outdoor swing dance event that takes place every Sunday in Golden Gate Park. 

The event is open to the public and takes place near the de Young Museum. There is no need for a partner, as leaders and followers rotate throughout the lesson.
event_name: “Lindy in the Park” Swing Dance Party (Golden Gate Park)

location: 6th Ave. and Kennedy Drive, San Francisco, CA Golden Gate Park San Francisco
event_description:
There is a place in San Francisco's Golden Gate Park that is heaven for Bay Area inline skaters and roller skaters who like to boogie to the funky beat on wheels. The Godfather of Skate brings his mobile DJ unit and plays groovy tunes for you to skate to. On most Sundays, there's usually someone willing to teach you a few choreographed roller disco dance moves.

The area is called, "Skatin' Place." It is located at 6th Avenue and Kennedy Drive in the park. It has been officially dedicated and recognized as the home for outdoor roller skating in the San Francisco. Skaters gather on Wednesdays from about 3 to 5 pm and on Saturdays from 1 to 5 pm. During Daylight Saving Time, they extend the time to 6 pm.
event_name: Golden Gate Park Sunday Roller Disco Party (SF)

location: 75 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr, San Francisco, CA
event_description:
The Japanese Tea Garden provides visitors from around the world with an opportunity to experience the natural beauty, tranquility and harmony of a Japanese-style garden in the heart of San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park. 

The Japanese Tea Garden features classic elements such as an arched drum bridge, pagodas, stone lanterns, stepping stone paths, native Japanese plants, serene koi ponds and a zen garden.
event_name: Free Admission Hour “Japanese Tea Garden” at Golden Gate Park (SF)

event_description:
The Speakeasy Ales & Lagers brewery is celebrating its legacy by hosting a special month-long pop-up comedy festival every Friday night. 
     These are the freshest pints you can get in San Francisco, since they’re right from the brewery’s taps. Every Friday Night at 7pm and 9pm. 
     VIP “SHOUT OUT” OPTION – Want to wish someone an unforgettable happy birthday? Want one of the comics to say hi to your date? Or want to feel the burn and have a comic roast someone in your group? One of our comics will give you a special shout out from the stage. Limited to maximum of 2 per show.
event_name: SF’s Winterfest Beer & Comedy Festival 2023 (Speakeasy Brewery)

location: San Francisco, CA
event_description: The San Francisco Bike Party is a monthly celebration of biking that takes place in San Francisco. Every month, there is a different theme, and participants are encouraged to dress up. The rides are fun and safe, and participants are encouraged to bring positivity and contribute to good times while being respectful to others. The event is organized by a co-op, by and for bike enthusiasts, and is run by volunteers who plan the routes, test ride them, help participants ride in control, avoid traffic disruption, and not get lost.
event_name: San Francisco Bike Party (First Fridays)

price: Free with RSVP (normally $15-20). Two drink minimum required
location: 1233 Polk St. San Francisco, CA 94154Polk Gulch, TenderloinSan Francisco
event_description:
Comedians with Criminal Records is a unique showcase of professional comics who have had troubles with the law in the past. In addition to an hilarious comedy set, you'll also hear the back-story of the comedian and the crime they committed and how stand-up comedy (hopefully) helped get them back on the straight and narrow. And it all takes place at the historic MAYES OYSTER HOUSE, one of the most historic bars on Polk Street and the perfect start to an insanely fun night of bar hopping.
Every Saturday Night
7p + 9p Shows each night – 21+
Mayes Oyster House, 1233 Polk St., SF – NEW VENUE FOR 2023!
Guestlist limited to first 75 people per show – RSVP quickly!
event_name: “Comedians with Criminal Records” Live in SF (2023)
